definition: cavity of body/barrel (e.g. engine cylinder)/compartment/tune/accent of speech

sentences.english: Backstage at the "girlie" show at the state fair.
sentences.chinese: 在後臺的“娘娘腔”，在公平的狀態顯示。

sentences.english: Tons of Americans are cake boys. So yeah they could beat these cissies.
sentences.chinese: 許多美國人是奶油小生，所以他們能打敗這些娘娘腔。

sentences.english: Girls get fed up with the feminine nature of the men.
sentences.chinese: 女孩兒們更是受夠了那些陰柔的娘娘腔。

sentences.english: When you're around a woman you like, don't act like a GIRLY-MAN.
sentences.chinese: 當你圍繞着你心愛的女人時，不要表現得像個娘娘腔。

sentences.english: I don't really think you're a sissy . You're a little girly .
sentences.chinese: 我不覺得你是個娘娘腔，你就是有點女性化。

sentences.english: I think he’s an awful sissy .
sentences.chinese: 我覺得他這個人太娘娘腔了。

sentences.english: This boy is kind of a sissy, so other kids make fun of him.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩有點娘娘腔，所以別的孩子會嘲笑他。

sentences.english: Fang is a dance instructor who appears sissy. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 方先生是一個舞蹈教練誰似乎娘娘腔。

sentences.english: And the object of promotion basically is the male when, most avoid sentimental is sissy.
sentences.chinese: 而推廣的對象主要是男性時，又最忌婆婆媽媽娘娘腔。

definition: flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
lit. pale-faced scholar (idiom); young and inexperienced person without practical experience/still wet behind the ears
